column1:
To include products per category
All products needs to be in the specified category, the simples and the configurable products. You can check this in the category structure on product level.
To exclude products per category
If a product is in multiple categories and that category is not excluded the product is not excluded as well. You can check this in the category structure on product level.
column2:
To include products per category
All products needs to be in the specified category, the simples and the configurable products. You can check this in the category structure on product level.
To exclude products per category
If a product is in multiple categories and that category is not excluded the product is not excluded as well. You can check this in the category structure on product level.

column1:
Activate
Identifier exists = FALSE
Now you inform Google that you don't have product identifiers on the products.
Activate when less than two
Identifier exists = FALSE
Now you inform Google that you don't have product identifiers on the products but only on products with less then 2 product identifiers in your feed.
Deactivate
Identifier exists = TRUE
Now you inform Google that you do have product identifiers on the products, this value is not visible.
column2:
Activate
Identifier exists = FALSE
Now you inform Google that you don't have product identifiers on the products.
Activate when less than two
Identifier exists = FALSE
Now you inform Google that you don't have product identifiers on the products but only on products with less then 2 product identifiers in your feed.
Deactivate
Identifier exists = TRUE
Now you inform Google that you do have product identifiers on the products, this value is not visible.

column1:
Production/Live License Key
Make sure the shown license server below is matching your license server in your license key overview.
Whenever it shows a invalid license key you can compare the license server name with the domain in your license dashboard to make sure it's correct. You can change the live key one time.

Change or Add a Staging/Development Keys
If you need an extra license key for your staging/development environment you can login to your account and generate development/staging keys. Read more information about the licenses.

"
column2:
Production/Live Licentie Key
Make sure the shown license server below is matching your license server in your license key overview.
Whenever it shows a invalid license key you can compare the license server name with the domain in your license dashboard to make sure it's correct. You can change the live key one time.

Change or Add a Staging/Development Keys
If you need an extra license key for your staging/development environment you can login to your account and generate development/staging keys. Read more information about the licenses.

column1: Each store view will have their own Google Shopping feed, you can easily activate or de-activate the Google Shopping feed generation on store level or automatically generate the Google Shopping feed. In case your not using the cron job functionality it's possible to generate the Google Shopping feed manually.
column2: Each store view will have their own Google Shopping feed, you can easily activate or de-activate the Google Shopping feed generation on store level or automatically generate the Google Shopping feed. In case your not using the cron job functionality it's possible to generate the Google Shopping feed manually.

column1:

On Product Level
Catalog » Manage Products » Select Product » Google Shopping Tab » Google Shopping Product Category.

On Category Level

On Product Level

column1: Products are categorized in Google Shopping according to the Google product taxonomy. Use the most specific product category to meet the Google requirements. Click here to read more about the Google product Taxonomy. For more information how to configure the category see our Knowledge Base.
column2: Products are categorized in Google Shopping according to the Google product taxonomy. Use the most specific product category to meet the Google requirements. Click here to read more about the Google product Taxonomy. For more information how to configure the category see our Knowledge Base.

column1:
Products are categorized in Google Shopping according to the Google product taxonomy. While Google can't guarantee that a product will show in a particular category, you can increase the chances that your products will be included in the most relevant categories by sending them highly structured information for your items. Click here to read more about the Google product Taxonomy inlcuding the different categories. For more information how to set this up per category see our Knowledge Base
You can overwrite this value if you want to specify the category.
On Category Level : Catalog » Manage Categories » Select Category » Feeds » Google Product Category
or
On product Level : Catalog » Manage Products » Select Product » Google Shopping Tab » Google Shopping Product Category.
column2:
Products are categorized in Google Shopping according to the Google product taxonomy. While Google can't guarantee that a product will show in a particular category, you can increase the chances that your products will be included in the most relevant categories by sending them highly structured information for your items. Click here to read more about the Google product Taxonomy inlcuding the different categories. For more information how to set this up per category see our Knowledge Base
You can overwrite this value if you want to specify the category.
On Category Level : Catalog » Manage Categories » Select Category » Feeds » Google Product Category
or
On product Level : Catalog » Manage Products » Select Product » Google Shopping Tab » Google Shopping Product Category.

column1: Required according to the Unique Product Identifier Rules for all target countries except for Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, India, Mexico, Norway, Poland, Russia, Sweden, and Turkey. This attribute is recommended for Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, India, Mexico, Norway, Poland, Russia, Sweden, and Turkey. Note: Don't provide your store name as the brand unless you manufacture the product.
column2: Required according to the Unique Product Identifier Rules for all target countries except for Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, India, Mexico, Norway, Poland, Russia, Sweden, and Turkey. This attribute is recommended for Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, India, Mexico, Norway, Poland, Russia, Sweden, and Turkey. Note: Don't provide your store name as the brand unless you manufacture the product.

column1: The ‘product type’ attribute can also indicates the category of the product being sold. Other then the Google Category Taxonomy gives the Product Types attribute more control over how your products are segmented as it uses your Magento Category structure.
column2: The ‘product type’ attribute can also indicates the category of the product being sold. Other then the Google Category Taxonomy gives the Product Types attribute more control over how your products are segmented as it uses your Magento Category structure.

column1: The condition is an required field for the feed. Only three options are available: New, Refurbished & Used. Please select the default condition of your products, when you change the condition on product-level in the Google Shopping Tab the product-condition will be overwritten.
column2: The condition is an required field for the feed. Only three options are available: New, Refurbished & Used. Please select the default condition of your products, when you change the condition on product-level in the Google Shopping Tab the product-condition will be overwritten.

column1: The Identifier Exists value informs Google if the products have valid product identifiers as a GTIN or MPN, in this way you can tell Google that there isn't an identifier as it doesn't exists, this could be custom goods as hand made products. With the Identifier Exists attribute on False it tells Google that there aren't any product identifier available for the product. We recommend using correct product identifiers if possible. More information
column2: The Identifier Exists value informs Google if the products have valid product identifiers as a GTIN or MPN, in this way you can tell Google that there isn't an identifier as it doesn't exists, this could be custom goods as hand made products. With the Identifier Exists attribute on False it tells Google that there aren't any product identifier available for the product. We recommend using correct product identifiers if possible. More information

column1: The Manufacturer Part Number is used to reference and identify a product using a manufacturer specific naming other than GTIN. MPNs are assigned by a manufacturer. MPNs should typically be specific to a single unique product. For example, different colors of a product should have different MPNs.
column2: The Manufacturer Part Number is used to reference and identify a product using a manufacturer specific naming other than GTIN. MPNs are assigned by a manufacturer. MPNs should typically be specific to a single unique product. For example, different colors of a product should have different MPNs.

column1: This is the weight of the product used to calculate the shipping cost of the item. If you have specified a global shipping method that is dependent on shipping weight (Merchant Dashboard), this attribute will be used to calculate the shipping cost of the item automatically.
column2: This is the weight of the product used to calculate the shipping cost of the item. If you have specified a global shipping method that is dependent on shipping weight (Merchant Dashboard), this attribute will be used to calculate the shipping cost of the item automatically.

column1: This new attribute was created for shops that offer custom goods without an identifier like GTIN or MPN. Custom goods are hand knitted sweaters or antique furniture or vintage items. The ‘Identifier Exists’ field can be used to indicate that an identifier does not exist for certain products: Identifier exists = false. Not required for regular goods.
column2: This new attribute was created for shops that offer custom goods without an identifier like GTIN or MPN. Custom goods are hand knitted sweaters or antique furniture or vintage items. The ‘Identifier Exists’ field can be used to indicate that an identifier does not exist for certain products: Identifier exists = false. Not required for regular goods.

column1: This option allows you to exclude product from the Google Shopping Feed. To exclude certain products from the Google Shopping feed you easily select yes in the Google Shopping tab on your product configuration page.
column2: This option allows you to exclude product from the Google Shopping Feed. To exclude certain products from the Google Shopping feed you easily select yes in the Google Shopping tab on your product configuration page.

column1: This option allows you to include/exclude product from the Google Shopping Feed. To exclude certain products from the Google Shopping feed you easily select yes in the Google Shopping tab on your product configuration page.
column2: This option allows you to include/exclude product from the Google Shopping Feed. To exclude certain products from the Google Shopping feed you easily select yes in the Google Shopping tab on your product configuration page.

column1: This overwrites the maximum amount of memory in bytes that a script is allowed to allocate, eg: 1024M.
column2: This overwrites the maximum amount of memory in bytes that a script is allowed to allocate, eg: 1024M.

column1: This overwrites the maximum time in seconds a script is allowed to run before it is terminated by the parser, eg: 300 (for 5 minutes).
column2: This overwrites the maximum time in seconds a script is allowed to run before it is terminated by the parser, eg: 300 (for 5 minutes).

column1: This section lists all the available attributes for the Google Shopping Feed. Some attributes are required for all products and some are required for certain product types such as apparel, others are recommended. To avoid errors in the Google Shopping feed please make sure that you provide  all recommended attributes.
column2: This section lists all the available attributes for the Google Shopping Feed. Some attributes are required for all products and some are required for certain product types such as apparel, others are recommended. To avoid errors in the Google Shopping feed please make sure that you provide  all recommended attributes.

column1: Use the GTIN/Barcode attribute to submit Global Trade Item Numbers (GTINs) in one of the following formats: UPC (in North America), EAN (in Europe), JAN (in Japan) or ISBN (for books). Please select the attribute that provide these GTINs (for eg. SKU).
column2: Use the GTIN/Barcode attribute to submit Global Trade Item Numbers (GTINs) in one of the following formats: UPC (in North America), EAN (in Europe), JAN (in Japan) or ISBN (for books). Please select the attribute that provide these GTINs (for eg. SKU).

column1: Use the paging function on big catalogs, e.g. catalogs of 50.000 SKU, use 5.000 per page.
When the tax percentage is 21% use 21.
column2: When the tax percentage is 21% use 21.

column1: We don't recommend to export the Configurable Parent product as the parent product can't be bought by itself.
column2: We don't recommend to export the Configurable Parent product as the parent product can't be bought by itself.

column1: When using configurable products you can choose to pull information from the parent products. It's specified as 'Configurable products - non apparel' or 'Apparel' markup so activate the Apparel setting to enable the Apparel markup in your feed. Select in the multiple-select box below the fall-back data for the configurable products in the feed.
column2: When using configurable products you can choose to pull information from the parent products. It's specified as 'Configurable products - non apparel' or 'Apparel' markup so activate the Apparel setting to enable the Apparel markup in your feed. Select in the multiple-select box below the fall-back data for the configurable products in the feed.

column2: You are recommended to provide the following product information for each unique item you submit if it exists, is relevant, and if the information fits into the accepted values for the following detailed product attributes:

column1: You can add custom-fields to your feed when needed. Please make sure that your using the latest Custom Fields standards To prevent error messages in the feed. The guidelines for the custom-fields can be found right in our Knowledgebase.
column2: You can add custom-fields to your feed when needed. Please make sure that your using the latest Custom Fields standards To prevent error messages in the feed. The guidelines for the custom-fields can be found right in our Knowledgebase.

column2: You can find your provided license key on your order confirmation mail or login to your account on Magmodules.eu and go to the my license keys tab.
